subject: Re: [junit] Parameterized test case pattern
msgSnippet: I m not sure why it fails, but this example is more Java-driven than Data-driven to me. Here is the data-driven version with TestNG: # # data.properties # 1 2
messageBody:
I'm not sure why it fails, but this example is more Java-driven than
Data-driven to me.

Here is the data-driven version with TestNG:

#
# data.properties
#
1
2

Java code:

@DataProvider(name = "provider")
public Object[][] createData() {
// return the content of data.properties, basically equivalent to:
// return new Object[][] { new Object[] { 1 }, new Object[] { 2 } }.
}

@Test(dataProvider = "provider")
public void foo(int n) {
Assert.assertTrue(n > 0);
}

Notice two things:

- The data is cleanly separated from the test logic: add lines to
data.properties and you automatically increase your testing coverage
without any recompilation.

- The test receives the data to test in parameters. No more ugly
field


--
Cédric
http://testng.org




On 11/13/05, Elliotte Rusty Harold <elharo@...> wrote:
>
> import junit.framework.*;
> import junit.textui.TestRunner;
>
> public class DataDrivenTest extends TestCase{
>
> int i;
>
> public DataDrivenTest(int i) {
> this.i = i;
> }
>
> public static Test suite() {
> TestSuite result = new TestSuite();
> result.addTest(new DataDrivenTest(1));
> result.addTest(new DataDrivenTest(2));
> return result;
> }
>
>
> public void testFoo() {
> assertTrue(i > 0);
> }
>
> public static void main(String[] args) {
> TestRunner.run(suite());
> }
> }
>
>
> Typical output is:
> .F.F
> Time: 0.025
> There were 2 failures:
> 1) null(DataDrivenTest)junit.framework.AssertionFailedError
> at DataDrivenTest.main(DataDrivenTest.java:25)
> 2) null(DataDrivenTest)junit.framework.AssertionFailedError
> at DataDrivenTest.main(DataDrivenTest.java:25)
>
> FAILURES!!!
> Tests run: 2, Failures: 2, Errors: 0
>
> What am I missing? Why does this fail?
>
>
>
>
> Yahoo! Groups Links
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
